str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aiteo; a cause, i.e. reason, crime.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bring a charge against, accuse. From en and kaleo; to call in, i.e. Bring to account.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From kata and ago; to lead down; specially, to moor a vessel.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.
